other_tests.findings: A large, circumferential pericardial effusion with right atrial inversion, diastolic inversion of the right ventricular wall, and respiratory variation in the intracardiac flows.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No reaccumulation of the pericardial effusion was observed on the second hospital day.

other_tests.findings: 370 ml of bloody fluid was removed; pericardial pressure decreased from 7 to 0 mm Hg.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Fluid drained decreasing amounts during the next 48 hours and was removed.

other_tests.findings: 16 mm of induration developed two days after discharge.
Decreased size of anterior mediastinal lymph nodes, new right pleural effusion, and nodular opacities in the right upper lobe with one decreased in size.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A new right pleural effusion developed.

other_tests.findings: Widening of the carina; normal mucosa.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Biopsy specimens showed necrotizing granulomas with caseation.
